humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the tumor size as 2.5 cm, which falls within the range for T2 tumors (more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm). The tumor is classified as a poorly differentiated lobular carcinoma, which follows the same rules as invasive ductal carcinoma for staging purposes. The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, so despite the presence of lymph node involvement and other findings, the T stage is T2 based on the size provided.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The tumor diameter is 2.5 cm, which falls within the T2 category (tumor size > 2 cm and <= 5 cm) according to the TNM staging system for cancer. The other findings in the report (focal slight intraductal spread, invasion of lymph vessels, and lobular carcinoma, G III) do not affect the T stage. Therefore, the pathologic T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.
